author: Leko Fraggle
comment: Two things...  One,  it looks like a nice app. But we will never know because ALL FUNCTIONALITY IS BEHIND A PAY WALL.  That is your prerogative as a dev,  but consumers will go elsewhere.  Two,  the algorithm for adding daylight savings time is the easiest programming feat there is (even if you had people do it manually). Without that,  this app is deadly.   Buyer beware.

author: Adam Lein
comment: There's a time display that does not match current time; minutes are right but hour is wrong by 8 so probably not applying time zone correctly. It's hard to match up the displayed tide heights with tide heights listed by other services, they seem to be off by a few minutes at least. I can't change the units tide heights are displayed in. I can't reorder locations. Lack of dst support is a problem.
title: Lots of problems

author: Gee Bee
comment: Don't get it.what good is a beach in France when I live on the other side of the world.i ain't going to buy because 1.i don't know how accurate/stable it is and 2.it only shows two beaches where I love and there is at 50+ around Auckland.

author: John Bouchard
comment: Doesnt work.  Pick a beach function inoperative even after paying fee.  Can not find any tools or settings to work wiith.

author: Rodrigo Souza
comment: Paid to unlock the locations and added 4. Checked one myself and it was correct. Nice work. A watch face with the tide info would be great!
title: So far so good

author: Kelly & Cary Cover
comment: Time zone messed up.  Useless app without correct time.
title: WatchTide

author: Stephen Carter
comment: Can only display one in france. Wont let you pick the one closest to me. Does not uninstall from watch????
title: 2700 beaches???

author: Alejandro Moulier Piñero
comment: How will I know if this work is I can't check the tides I my zone?
title: How???
